content.detailedDescription: Weekend drive to the foothills....Taking pictures of the scenery and if i'm lucky that day i usually catch one of these guys in the frame.  i cannot see these with my eyes....They are so very quick and silent, i am only able to catch one with a camera.
content.summary: Taking pictures of scenery and got lucky

content.detailedDescription: En ese momento estaba jugando en la plaza con un amigo y sent������a algo extra������o en el cielo, mire hacia arriba y este objeto paso r������pidamente de norte a sur muy bajo pensamos que era un avi������n pero no se escucho nada que nos hiciera pensar que era un avi������n av������a sido la primera ves que lo vi. y al ver r������pidamente el objeto le avise pero muy r������pido a mi amigo y lo alcanzo haber justo antes que desapareciera y nos quedamos con la duda de que pudo ser y seguimos jugando.
content.summary: Plateado, con forma de semi circulo, con tres especies como ventanas negras.

content.detailedDescription:
Was driving a triaxle truck i bought in utah back to pa and was on i80 around 10 pm or so around davenport, iowa. i qas a little road weary from driving so long in subzero (-22) weather with bad road conditions so the time and place are approximate.  heading eastbound on i80, a bright, led stop-light green colored sphere-like light caught my right eye out the upper portion of my passenger window.  it was zooming ahead of me fast like something in a sci-fi movie.  as the roads were treacherous (vehicles all over the side of the road from wrecks), i glanced back at the road for a moment and lost sight of it.  seconds later, the cb radio came on with a trucker in the area exclaiming "what the f@#$ was that?"  i asked back, "what did you see?"  he said, "a green flash going through the sky!"  about 3 or 4 other cbers responded that they were glad somebody else saw it because they weren't going to say anything thinking they were going crazy from driving too long or something.  i estimate the diameter of the light of a quarter at arms length. i've seen a white comet-like light with a tail that stopped & disappeared on i76 in western pa and 3 other family members have seen 3 other "unknown" objects since june, 2007 in pa... my fiance is really into this ufo thing now and is going to build a near-infrared webcam to try and film them in daylight like on youtube.  (there are alot of hoax videos on youtube but alot of real ones too--like the nasa ones--do a search!) we think they consider us "planet zoo" and observe us like we do isolated tribes in the jungle... or, on the wilder side, they could be from our distant, more evolved future? both would explain their lack of involvement....
:o
content.summary: Bright green sphere seen by i80 near davenport, iowa as i was eastbound.

content.detailedDescription: Estava fotografando o morro 3 irm���o, na chapada diamantina, bahia, brasil. tirei um total de duas fotografias. na primeira n���o aparece nada al���m da paisagem, nem avi���o, bal���o, inseto, p���ssaro. na segunda apareceu o ovni. utilizei uma camera canon 20d, com lente sigma 17-55mm. a velocidade de disparo foi 1/320,  f-11, iso 100, dist���ncia focal 50mm. na realidade n���o v��� o objeto. s��� vi ap���s ter fotografado. depois v��� que havia um outro objeto, mais ao longe.
content.summary: Ovni na chapada diamantina - bahia - brasil

content.detailedDescription: My family went to eat and while i was home i received a frantic call urging me to look outside. my husband instructed me to look outside the second story bedroom window. i looked out and say a bright object. i ran outside to look closer. my immediate reaction was it looked like a moon between clouds then i looked around and the sky was clear. then i was thinking it was an advertising blimp. but then i realized it was none of these i rushed to my garage and retrieved my telescope without the base. by now my family had returned and we were all looking at it. after several attempts i got it completely focused in my scope and could not believe my eyes. it was no craft of any sort it was and eye shaped orb that seemed to look like a contact lens being squeezed and inside the orb was a red light sort bouncing and moving. directly on the left of the orb was a bright light looking similar to a star in the scope. it was not directly up it was directly above the horizon line. my family (4 adults) all saw it after dinner and stopped and got out of the car to observe it. they all said it stopped on a dime and moved fast. we are all overwhelmed by what we saw.
content.summary: Eye shaped orb color of a harvest moon with a red light in the center and a bright light just outside of it.

content.detailedDescription:
My brother and i arrived at mayrhofen, austria on 01/17/09 for our skiing holiday.  i went outside at 21:43 to have a cigarette on the balcony.  it was a very clear night and i was looking at the reflection of the light on the snowy mountains.  i saw a red light appear from behind a nearby mountain and continued to rise into the sky, slowly.  the object moved very slight to to the left and right but not very much.  i did not know what the object was, it was definately not an aircraft, it had no lights and had no propulsion/exchaust trails.

i called my brother out to see, he told me to get the camera.  i took a short video but this was bad quality.  i took a photograph and when zoomed by 200% was a red circle, with an outer bright border and a bright central dot.

the object moved slowly upwards and then gained speed quickly, again going outwards and reducing in visibility.  the object then disappeared, in that it had gained extreme speed as opposed to disappearing.

my brother and i were convinced that this object was nothing that we had seen previously or had seen on any unbelievable ufo you tube video.  this led to speculation and eventually reporting on this website.

photograph to be uploaded...
content.summary: Red circle with bright outer border and central bright 'dot' sighted above mayrhofen, austria.

content.detailedDescription: We were in a parking lot on the pacific coast highway in malibu. not exactly sure what direction it went across the sky.
content.summary: Appeared to be a meteor & it changed colors as it fell across the sky. green, blue, orange.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting at my t.V. watching an einstein show on the history channel, when my cat was looking out the window and started meowing. i looked out the window, and was completely frightened. there was a triangle of orange lights, with sporadically placed orange lights throughout. 

i live near o'hare, so i see planes all the time. they are about a third the size of what i saw, and planes have red and blue lights that blink in a repeated pattern and in the same spot on the plane. the object was about 3x the size, had no red or blue lights, and was off the normal flight path for planes. the object didn't make a noise, like planes sometimes do, and flew at a slightly faster pace. 

at first i thought it was some bright stars, maybe a meteor shower, but they were synchronized, and flew in a straight line together.

it first flew in a north-north-west direction, and then curved north, or more east, without turning or altering it's shape in any way. 

i felt my heart jump out of my chest, and afterwards i found myself hyperventilating, and simply shocked. i couldn't, and still don't believe my eyes fully. 

after curving it's path, it flew out of sight in the houses and trees. i stayed at my window for atleast 20-30 minutes watching for if it came back. it never did. i saw another plane, however, just minutes later, and compared the two. again, they were nothing alike. 

i am reporting this the same night.

please, take this account into consideration.
content.summary: Triangle of yellow and orange lights.

content.detailedDescription: Around dusk, on halloween 2008, while waiting at a stoplight[w. georgia@rocky creek road] i saw a white light aproaching in the sky. it passed from the front to the left of my vehicle at about 200 feet altitude and maybe .25 miles distance. as it passed by my driver side window i could make out the silhouette of a jet fighter. the stoplight changed, and when i got up to speed, the object came in view on my left, passed in front, then over the horizon. i them made a left turn for the final .25 miles of my drive home passed on my left, going maybe 50 mph at 100 feed altitude and 300 feet away.  it overflew my house disappearing over some trees. then 5 seconds reappearing and retracing it steps, going out of view behind me. i pulled in my drive way when it flies over my house and out of sight. i am out of my vehicle now as it does two more fly overs, where i am realizing this is no ordianary plane. the speed is just too slow and the sound was just wind, or ground effect sound. also, the form seemed not fixed, maybe not fully solid. i also felt it was aware of my awareness of it. the only light from the object was white and visible when aproaching head on. the object looked like a jet fighter, maybbe 40 ft long with wings swept forward 60 degrees and downward 45 degrees. i remember thinking the landing gear must be 10 feet tall.  when it did it's 180 degree turns, it was like a car on ice.  when it left it just flew out of sight. it was then i noticed i was thinking of getting my rifle, but i feel it left as i was thinking of getting my rifle. this was a first for me, and will be the must memorable hallweens!
content.summary: Flyover by ufo on halloween 2008.

content.detailedDescription: Chucky cheese rest. off 57fwy in brea.  3 men in parking lot witnessed a fireball at low altitude for about 5 seconds.  they lost sight as it heading toward diamond bar.  did not hear a noise from it and it left no smoke trail.
content.summary: Small fireball at low altitude with 3 witnesses.

content.detailedDescription: My family  and i were camping in osceola county off highway 441, 7 miles north of kennasville in a wildlife management area called three lakes saturday evening on january 17, 2009 around 9:35pm.  we were by the campfire when my mom noticed a bright orange light coming out of the northeast sky approximately at a 10:00 position moving south.  it first was behind some low scattered clouds.  it then cleared the clouds and appeared to be a bright orange fireball the size of a full moon.  this object continued moving south for about 3 minutes at the same height until it reached the 1:00 position.  then the object slowed down and wavered side to side 3-5 times and suddenly vanished.  my first impression was that it was a plane on fire. the object seemed so close that i feared the plane would crash into or near the campground and how will i get my family out of the camper.
content.summary: The fireball came out of the northeast direction moving horizontally and moved side to side north to south and then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: At st. marks wildlife refuge facing the gulf /bay noticed  airplane moving high rate of speed . looked around and then looked almost straight up and noticed the triangle . took a pic of it , took pic of aircraft flying at high speed  , looked back at triangle it was gone . i am sending the high def pic so when you enlarge it you will see what im talking about . i use olympus e500 8 megpix with zuiko 70-300 zoom . i have gone back saturday and sunday and havent seen it anymore .
content.summary: Ufo seen at st. marks wildlife refuge above the bay.

content.detailedDescription: I saw a very bright light going from west to east. i live in lakewood, co. the light appeared at 548 pm and was observed until 553 pm. the light was very bright, no strobes or any navigation lights were visible. it was about the size of my finger at arm���s length and was solid white. it seemed to be at about 9000��� and stayed in a linear course. at the end of the observation, 553pm, changed to red and accelerated quickly into space.
content.summary: White light then red and accelerating.

content.detailedDescription: I noticed a light over the apartment building down the street from me. it was the size of a star but it appeared low enough that we could see planes and a helicopter flying higher and by it. we watched it for 15-20 mins. we looked w/ both binoculars and a telescope and could only make out a single light source. i did get video of it but because it was so cold that night, i only stayed out a few seconds at a time. because it was dark it is hard to see the light in the video but i tried to keep it in the middle of the picture above the building. it seemed to pulse or flicker a little. hopefully, you will be able to see it better if you can adjust the exposure?  it never moved and then we noticed it started to descend in a straight line down. it happened over a period of another 10 mins. or so and the just disappeared below the horizon.
content.summary: My 3rd sighting in this area.

content.detailedDescription: I looked up from my back patio enjoying the weather and i saw from north to south what looked like a straight line of lights with no spaces in between about 2 inches in horizon length fly straight across the sky with complete controlled speed and altitude. it left a minor blur of lights in its wake which faded quickly. i have seen many planes, meteors, and meteorites in my life and this looked like nothing i have ever encountered. i had time to call over a guy sitting on his back patio to look as well and he agreed it was def not a plane. the whole thing lasted what seemed like maybe 1-1 1/2 minutes.
content.summary: Bright yellow orange cigar shape, controlled speed and altitude.

content.detailedDescription:
This happened about 10 years ago or so and was the first of 3 sightings i've seen....Obviously i don't recall exact dates or times....
i had gone to a late afternoon matinee with a friend. we returned to my home about 7pm. as we got out of my car i noticed a copper-colored cigar shaped/cylindrical object moving through the valley that runs alongside of my home. it was silent and moving very slowly. i turned to my friend and asked him what it was...He said, "exactly what you think it is..." i watched it for about another 5-10 secs before i lost sight of it. it was very surreal and i wasn't sure what to think about what i saw...
content.summary: My 1st object sighting in this area.

content.detailedDescription: Bright white light was coming across the horizon heading at us. my son said dad look at the plane and i responded the plane/jet is this way over to the west. i looked to the south where he was looking to see the bright oval light. it came towards us up to the ne and over the local mtns towards the fish hatchery and then went straight up into the air until the massive light went dim out past the stars adn disappeared in a matter of only a few seconds or less.
content.summary: Bright white light across horizon heading at us up to mountain and out into space.

content.detailedDescription: Backing out of our drive i noticed a bright circular orange/yellow glowing object.  it was located in a westerly direction situated above the mountain ridges.  my daughter and i discussed that possibility of it being a planet.  we cotinued into town to pick up my husband.  we had to wait just a few minutes for him to finish up paperwork.  as we traveled home westbound on i40 we noticed that the object was still in the sky.  it seemed it had traveled a short distance southward as it was now south of i40.  however, the object appeared to be stationary.  it was a glowing orange/yellow with flashes of red.  the light was not pinpoint but was fuzzy.  to me it looked as if it were a fire.  as we continued toward our exit (a matter of 4 miles) it appeared that the object began "pouring lights" out from the left-hand side.  i saw the lights as more of a liquid process and my husband felt that it looked like a string of bright white lights.  according to him, this string seemed to be angled toward the ground as if on a boom although no structure was seen.  again, to me, it appeared as if orange, yellow and red light were pouring out of the oject.  shortly before we reached our exit we lost sight of the object behind a small hill on the south side of i40.  when we emerged and began our exit the object was gone (just a matter of seconds).  when i made my next trip back from town i tried to visualize where this object had been located.  due to the very small height of the hill behind which we lost sight of the object, it must have been very low to the ground.  this object was in the sky for appx. 25 to 30 minutes.  it's a 15 minute drive to the station, 5 or so minutes for my husband to join us, and 5 minutes to the point at which we could no longer see the object.  skies were clear, good visibilty.  no fog or smog.  temperature was probably in the low 30's.   my daughter and i have seen a couple of odd things in the sky before but my husband has been pretty much of a skeptic. however, he was uable to identify this object.  he and my daughter are big aircraft buffs and neither of them could identify what kind of light it might be.  it did not have the characteristics of a plane, helecopter, weather balloon, or hot air balloon.  we've watched the skies for it's return but haven't seen it again.
content.summary: Orange/yellow/red glowing object over northern az.

content.detailedDescription:
It was around 7:00 pm, i was leaning on the hood of my truck the sun had gone down about 35 minutes earlier and i was enjoying a smoke. i was facing north and looking at what i thought was orians belt but was amazed as to the size and brightness of the stars. i realized that orians belt would have been much smaller and to the southwest at the time. i saw three very bright lights at first i thought they were stars but they did not blink. they were brighter and larger then the brightest star that was visable (arcturus)which was slightly more to the west of what i was seeing. i also saw a jetliner traviling ftom west to east and about 300 miles anhour at about 3500 ft altitude. the lights i saw where higher and farthe away then the jet. the jet had flashing red and blue lights with one white strobe. when the jet reached the general location of the star on the bottom, the bottom star began to move to the west and at the same time the star on the top and the one in the center of the formation began to move in a synchronous motion the star on top moving to the west and the one in the center moving east while maintianing the same distance apart. when the two upper most stars stopped they formed a perfect triangle with the star on the bottom. after they all stopped moving the star on the bottom of the trianlg began moving up towards the center of the other two stars also while moving up the lower star began to fade as if it were going behind something. about two seconds after the center sar vanished the others made a slight flicker and then vanished into the night. abought that night, there were other stars out that night but none as bright and "no stars were visiblbe inside the triangle".
about me: i am 47 college grad currently in the computer field and have 26 years prior military service ranging from cav scout to power generation and i have served in combat. i know these lights were not flares, they were not helicopters or military aircraft. fort bliss and bigs airfield are about two mile to my west. whight sands testing range is 62 miles to the north by northwest and holoman afb is ruffly 75 to the north. 
has anyone else reported this or seen this. i have gathered my video camera with night vision and am going to try and catch it on tape as this was not the first time i have seen strange light around here. i have diagramed in ms paint 4 files showing what i saw and also will upload a topagrafical map of the location of what i saw.
content.summary: Strange lights moving in the northern sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving from 40th and locust to 44th and pennsylvania (approx 5 minutes), and the whole drive there were 6 glowing fireballs moving slowly through the sky. i didn't first notice them until i came to a stop sign, and just saw them in the sky. i don't recall what i first thought they were... ufo came to my mind rather instantaneously, though. they moved together in a formation of 2 interlocking triangles, but i could tell they were independent of each other. not all together rigid formation, but not all together loose movement, either. they were high in the sky, traveling in a general eastward direction. along the way, i saw people getting out of their cars to look at them, some taking photos. it was somehow an amazing feeling...I knew something big was happening.  after i reached my destination, i got out of the car, and they (after about 30sec) disappeared into the horizon.
content.summary: 6 glowing fireballs moving in 2 triangles over westport, kansas city 1-17-09 10pm.

content.detailedDescription:
first event.I went up on our roof-deck to look up at the stars, but on the way up i noticed something glowing to the south of us, just above the water over newport beach, or costa mesa. it seemed to be bagel or doughnut shaped, and it was discharging some sort of super hot material straight down into the water, almost like molten metal. it did this for about 5-10 minutes, and then appeared to fall into the ocean after, or just simply faded away. i don't know where it went.
 the only thing i can compare this to, is the event that happened in washington state, where almost the exact same thing occurred, but a fisherman's boat was struck in that account.
 
 second event. just as soon as the first craft disappeared, a second multi-colored thing, (it had red, orange, green, & white lights) was flying north. the flight area area would be from the northern tip of santa catalina island to long beach, or rancho palos verdes. it hovered for about 5-8 minuutes, then slowly descended toward the ocean until it seemed to go into to the water.
 
 i face southwest when looking to the sea. a map of long beach down to newport beach would be more helpful in pinpointing these sightings.
content.summary: 2 different sightings minutes apart between 8-8:30 pm.

content.detailedDescription: Since i have moved to this location dec.23, 2005 i have had the distinct feeling i have been stalked. it started with an uneasy feeling, and escalated to a fear of the unknown. in the winter of 2006 while out side with my pups for their last potty break of the evening i happened to notice an object hovering above the pine trees n.N.W. or my home. my pups were uneasy and barking, i finally got them inside turned off the inside and out side lights so i could get a better look at what i had seen. when i looked again there were two crafts side by side now, they were long rectangular shapes or ovals, i'm not sure all i can remember was the lights.  they appeared to be opaque in color but bright. blue, red, and clear white. there could have even been a green one between the red and white one. they slowly moved off to the north over cookshammock grade towards the north. the feeling of fear seemed to lesson over the next few days to a week. as if something in the neighborhood had changed.  since thuis time i have started keeping a journal of events and my feelings as each events occurs.  these are just a few of the major events i can remember, sometimes i think my memories are blocked on purpous, it may be a day or two or longer before i think to record them in my journal.  a week or so before june 23,2008, i ranto the grneral store in cookshammock at about 11:30 to 11:45, on my return trip i noticed a smoky star at the  "y" intersection of carber rd. and cookshammock grade. it was above the tree tops at about a 45 degree angle or a little more.( i'm not good at judging distances) the star was larger than any other star i could see, the most prominant, it was whitish in the center, and a smoky color around the edges. i continued on home and thought nothing more of it.  on 6?23?08 i was on my way to gainesville fl.And i saw the same colored star only lower in the western sky. i could see it through the clear cur areas along highway 51 going north at 4:30 am. i checked to see if there were other stars, it was clear no fog no clouds, i obsurved the star for 11 miles into town. it did not arrear to be mocing or droping in the sky. i did have a spooked feeling. i slowed but did not stop. i lost sight of it ehen i reached mayo.  on 9?9?08 i observed a pure white orb through my living room window at about 8:45 to 9:00pm. it was only a flash, but long enough to tell it was an orb. a few minutes later(2-3) a low flying aircraft flew over my house, at 500 to a 1000 feet. it was skimming the tree tops.   on contacted mufon 8/28/08,spoke to b.P. and d.S. orlando fl.   second orb i saw a pure white falling star while out with my pups, last call of the night a few seconds later a perfectly white orb flashed through the trees accross the road from my home. about the size of a thumb tack. no reflections of light on trees.?????  waited for orb to go up in sky again but saw nothing. dogs were barking furiously, some one yelled shut up and every thing went silent. ti was cold but it suddenly became even colder. a jet was going overhead and i could not hear the sound of it after it passed by, which i thought was very unusual. got the pups back inside and continued to watch, but saw nothing else. then all of a sudden i heard the cyotes howling and yepping to the north of me, i went back inside and to bed. myself and the pups were sick for a few days after that. one would not eat(b) and(t) the other had a rash on his stomach. my cat smooth had a bald spot behind his two frount legs, and would not stay in the house for longer than to eat. i was sick to my stomach for about 3 days and could only eat saltines. since then i have had problems sleeping. the pups have been aggitated.This was 10-20-28-08contacted by m.M.Z. mufon10-29-08. since then i have had a continuous series of unexplained marks on my body. little marks on my collar bone like cat scratches, soar and irritated, small round, wounds above my ankle on my left foot and leg. strange dreams, feeling sick again,pups aggitated. where i had my tooth removed in6?23?08 a strange gray object worked its way out of the wound. unfortunately i threw it away.  but afrer an mri in december i had a boil appear behind my upper left(last)moler and now there appears or feels like some thing is wedged in behind it.  12-20-08 my son and i were returning from gainesville and my grand daughters graduation, we took a rural route home, on our home i saw a light through the trees, i thought it might be a hunting camp or tower of some kind, but it was not it is to swampy in that area for anything like that. i never minentioned it to my son as the road is rough aand we had a 45 degree turn to make up the road. it did how ever seem to me now thst it took longer to get home thsn it should have.   since then i have had a rash in and around my navel,small blood moles appear on my stomach, like some ome put wax  on my stomach and pulled all the hair folicals out. my doctor said they could be the results of an infection. i do not know if my son has had any side effects, he has not mentioned it if he has.  signing off for now bar.   ps the last orbe was white  round and had red and blue light changes in the right side. i felt no alarm, just a little anxious. we only passed one truck on the road, with like very bright hallegin lights that were above the hood of my sons bronko. the road is uneven, bumpy and no dividing lines, so we had to drive slow, for about 10 miles or so until we got to the newly paved road section. about the size of a regulsr marble.            since this time i have noticed the water that flows from my bathroom faucet sometimes flows to the left rather than the right.????????? i thought it might be some kind of seddiment on the screan so i cleaned it it still dose it.  pss went to family cemitary recently, when i arrived it was cool my pups like to run and play search for deer sents. they did not allert to anything but when i went inside the fince there was a wooshing sound like a low flying jet, only not as loud as a jet, softer more muted then a rush of heat about 5-6 degrees warmer than it had previously been a seconed ago. i looked up the trees did not move with the sound or the heat. there was a sound like a deer snorting his/ her alarm, a seconed or two later there was a more throaty sound.  maybe a bear made it. but that would not explain the jet sound nor the heat i felt. needless to say i gathered the pups up and we left. i felt very uncomfortable and anxious. and i have felt that way ever since. this happoned two or three weeks ago.
content.shape: Circle,  Oval,  Sphere,  Square,  Rectagular,  Star-like,  Unknown
content.summary: Since moving to this location in 2005 i have had the feeling i have been stalked.

content.detailedDescription:
I woke up an was staring in the sky and saw a star like object flying through space
very high, then a few seconds later a fireball appeared like it came out of the middle of the
sky right above a large tree and shot downwards like a falling star behind the large tree.

the ball was orange with red outline.
content.summary: Fireball over lax.

content.detailedDescription:
Not my sighting, figured you might want it in your online database though. see ntnews article:
http://www.Ntnews.Com.Au/article/2009/01/17/27861_ntnews.Html
content.summary: Sighting with (bad) photos in state newspaper.

content.detailedDescription:
One type of sighting which is specific to england and some of it s areas is the phenomenon of ghose ww2 planes which appear exactly like ufo common sightings , out of the blue , remain silent when witnesses observe them , and disppear suddenly out of sight , however never dashing fast away as ufo s are well known for.

the question that arises here in the following example is to understand whether this apparently type of sighting should be considered that of an unidentified flying object.

in short , as ufo s can take any shape at will apparently , why would they not be able to take the shape of a ww2 aircraft ? does this make sense?

many believe this to rather be attached to the ghostly paranormal activity , however it is difficult for me to understand how "ghost" could appear having built an airplane with the same material they would be made of should they exist?

i d be very interested in any feedback about this very unique type of sightings ?Could they be classified as ufo, there are many witnesses including law enforcement officers.

 

ghost planes of the peak district of derbyshire 

the 24th march 1997 saw another in a long history of reported sightings of a propellor driven plane being witnessed flying low, in apparent difficulty and then seeming to crash on moors above sheffield. a rescue operation was launched but, as has happened before, no trace of any plane or crash was found despite a search involving 100 volunteers and police.
this latest incident was witnesses by several people who dialled 999 when they saw a plane in trouble. they were watching the pass of the comet hale-bopp on moors which are far enough away from the city lights and pollution to give them a good view of the comet.
gamekeeper michael ellison and his wife who live at strines spoke of hearing an almighty explosion. a farmer has spoken of him instinctively ducking when the plane passed over his head. a former police special constable marie france-tattersfield has reported that she and her husband (a former pilot) saw a low flying plane plunge to the ground over midhope moors. they reported seeing lights on the wings. 

the moors
there are several moors in the area but reports seem to centre on howden moors which cover quite a large area of the peak district to the north west of sheffield. nearby features are the derwent & ladybower reservoirs to the south of the area in question. this region has been the site of many plane crashes during and since the second world war. over 50 planes have come to grief in this area. more than 300 people have lost their lives in these crashes.
 one captain landon t tranner and his crew perished in the crash of their b29 bomber in 1945. two crashes at the end of the war claimed the lives of 13 airmen. on 18th may 1945, a royal canadian lancaster bomber of 408 sqn crashed at james thorn on bleaklow hill. in july 1945, a us dakota crashed on the same peak. a superfortress and another dakota have also crashed in the area. more recently (1993), a privately owned hawker hunter jet crashed on broomhead moor in a storm. 

ghostly sightings
in april 1995, retired postman tony ingle saw the sun blocked out by the shadow of a plane 40/60 feet overhead. he could see the propellors rotating but there was no sound. he saw it banking and then it seemed to go down over a hedge. when he ran to the field, it was empty. his dog, which he was taking for a walk at the time, now refuses to go into that field.
ron collier is a local farmer who set up a group to study the sightings. he is regularly contacted by people who have seen ghost planes. 
 a group who used a ouija board obtained the names of the crewmen of the 1948 fortress plane and a message that they were not at rest where they were. this could be a reference to the fact that bodies are not always recovered from crash sites. the crash site of the privately owned hawker hunter jet is still the resting place of the body of the pilot wallace cubitt who is believed to be entombed perhaps 30 feet below the boggy ground.
a farmer picked up debris from one site and stowed it in an outhouse until his son saw the barn almost shake itself to pieces. the pieces were returned and the incident has not happened again. another man who recovered the ring of a crewman says that he has been visited by a ghost.
somewhere, there is a book which gives the sites of plane crash sites in the peak district. these sites still display the odd signs of debris at the scenes. 

re the 24/3/97 incident, an email has been received by this site, reporting that a local mp explained in the houses of parliament that this incident may be connected with an raf plane breaking the sound barrier that night and that it may have been flying low in relation to the moors. 

we reproduce here also a selection of emails received on the subject of the above:-
i remember visiting the hendon aircraft museum with my son many years ago. an attender came up to us and explained that there were at times singular goings ons in the exhibition halls after dark; strong winds and various sounds. he ended by saying: 'if you think of the way some of these young men died, it is hardly surprising.'
the correspondent pc does seem a bit scathing - mediums and physicists seem to agree that matter can soak up and lock in energy.
your sincerely,
richard robertson

sirs,
with reference to the article on your web site, as an aviation historian & author on the subject of flying accidents, i thought i would just write to say that a few of the facts in your article : "ghost planes of the peak district" are incorrect.
for example. the b-29 bomber as described on page 1. was not a bomber, unlike its ww2 counterpart. but a photo recon` aircraft an rb-29a or f-13a. also it is mentioned on that same page that the aircraft crashed in 1945, when in fact it crashed on 3rd november 1948. the pilot was landon `p` tanner not landon `t` tanner. and the rumour that has persited that his ghost was seen near the crash site, i take to be utter nonesense, for it has been said, albeit not by you site, but local newspapers, that this airman, or perhaps an airman from the crash was roaming the moor. i might add that the crew of the f-13a were in a presurized cabin and there was no need for full flying kit. there is no such place as bleaklow mountain. there is a bleaklow, or bleaklow meadow. the place where the rb-29 (f-13a) struck is higher shelf stones, and the lancaster on james`s thorn is adjutant to shelf moor, where the c-47 sytrain, us military dakota crashed on 24/7/45. 
it says that another superfortress crashed in the area. it did not. the only other american fortress was b-17 flying fortress nr meltham. the other dakota was a dc-3 that crashed at wimberry stones, kinder intake, dovestones, nr greenfield on 19th august 1949 killing 21 of the 29 passengers & crew on board, including the pilot capt. frank pinkerton, a wartime lancaster pilot with 12 squadron raf bomber command. 
ron collier is not a farmer, but a glossop aviation historian, he wrote the books `dark peak aircraft wrecks`.
my name, should you require any further info on the peak district aircraft, is david w.Earl. i wrote the books : `hell on high ground` volumes 1&2. 
regards.
dwe. 

caroline writes:
myself and my sister have seen a ghostly plane at calver 3 times in the last few years. it was an old war type plane with propellers turning but totally silent, it was so low it was practically touching the roof of the eyre arms pub then it went below the level of the houses of calver village. other people saw it too as it was on radio derby. we saw it here another night but in the dark it had all its lights on and again was low in difficulty but totally silent. the final sighting was again near calver but this time it was directly above me on the calver - baslow road it was again silent and so low only 30 ish foot it banked to the left and then flew past me over a field so low i pulled over and watched it but it was just not there all of a sudden other people had seen it too as they too had stopped there cars. i cannot explain how this plane is so low and yet silent i just thought i'd share my sightings with you.
caroline. 

dear mr day,
i was asking about your web-article, ghost planes of the peak district, in order to discover the purpose for which it was compiled. seeing that every provable fact in it is erroneous, is it possible that it was intended as a spoof? on the other hand there is no indication that you intended it to be any other than informative. and that is how i shall regard it in covering the subject in a special section in (title removed), expected to published in december 2006. as i shall be unequivocally scathing about your article, i naturally wanted to give you the opportunity of defending such an ill-researched and puerile piece of work.
pc 

pc came back to us in 2006 with another broadside (maybe "broadside" is the wrong term as we're talking aviation here; anyone know the right term?), possibly seeking some publicity for his forthcoming book, which we will not be giving in light of his offensive attitude. here is his latest diatribe -
i had not anticipated coming back to you. but the manuscript of my (title removed) is now with the proof reader, which means that i have a final chance to ask if you have added any scholarship to your 2001 web article on ghost aircraft since i approached you on that head in march 2006.
you will appreciate that it is not your article's contention that ghosts -- even metal ghosts -- exist i find fault with, but the distortion of facts that are open to investigation. i have not, and have no intention of, revisiting your website -- which i hold to be one of those which so sadly devalues the web -- but, as before, i feel you should be offered the courtesy of explaining why you have ignored and distorted the facts; alternatively, afforded the opportunity of advising that you have put things right in the interim. my to-be-published references to your article are collated below:
more easily discounted are the vaporous utterances typified by the 2001 website, ���ghost planes of the peak district���, for these immediately disbar themselves by their overt sensationalism and duplicitous distortion of facts.
the fundamentally unsound ���ghost planes��� article purported to focus upon the broomhead moor search-and-rescue operation of 27 march 1997, mounted after a widely-reported moorland explosion. the histrionic spin the article applied, however, was to imply that the authorities had been mystified to find no wreckage; alternatively, that they had been misled by a ministry cover up.
... also the longdendale valley ������the haunted valley���, as ghost planes��� associate votaries would have it. 
i shall consider adapting my piece should your reply indicate that you have now actually researched the circumstances; but beyond this courtesy i have no intention of entering into further discussion with you: after all, your style of signing off last time, vis 'roger wilco, over and out', was so revealingly indicative of your unsuitability to write about any aspect of aviation.
pc. dfm, author of (title removed) series ...
content.summary: Ghost planes of derbyshire.

content.detailedDescription:
At 8:40 pm on 1-14-09, i was talking to my husband on the phone. he drives truck and was 180 miles away in michigan.  i got up to look out and see if it was snowing and noticed in the sky a large round light - my first thought was it was a plane and was concerned because it was very low & the light was very bright & round. i kept watching it as i was talking and it just stayed in one spot (hovered).  i saw a red flashing light a ways away and decided that was an airplane and it looked like it was going to crash into the bright light, but it went under it and kept on going, but then later came back.  i saw 2 or 3 lights that blinked that seem to move past it.  i couldn't quit watching it because of it staying in one place and i was convinced it was not an airplance, star, meator, blimp, weather balloon.  at that time i never considered a ufo.  
 
i had watched the "light" about 10 min and said something to my husband about the funny light in the sky.  before i could go on, he said he had been watching a bright light in the sky for about 30 minutes. he described it as i was seeing it, large, close,bright and never moving - there were no other visible stars in the sky and he thought it was really odd because it definitely wasn't an airplane.  so i continued to explain to him what i was seeing & we felt it could be the same thing, but how 180 miles apart? at the time i was sseing it he wasn't and had lost sight of it about 20 min before talking to me, but he said it stayed in 1 place at least 30 min when he was watching it.  i got the binoculars and what i could see i described as looking at a disco ball. round, bright and it looked like the sides were faceted. i probably watched it about 45 min and it did not move. i marked it's location by the point on the top of a house. towards the end of my watching it, it appeared to possible be turning around because the coloring changed - there were portions of blue and red on it. it was late, i was tired and decided i was being silly watching this "light".  i went back to watching a movie and came back about 20 minutes later and it was gone.  i could however, see a red circle farther towards the west,(as if it was moving in that direction - towards wells county.

i feel my husband and i possibly witnessed the same thing only we were 180 miles apart. how could that be? things i do know: there was not one visible star in the sky that night, the wind was fairly calm, i have always watched the stars and have never in 58 years seen anything like this, it hovered in one spot 45+ minutes (not sure how long it was there before i saw it), it was round and as i said it looked like a disco ball, it was not an airplane or helicopter,i never considered a ufo as i have never believed or disbelieved but i can't explain the feeling i have that is could be a ufo.  i have researched on line other possibilities - weather balloon, meators, a new star, but can't come up with anything.  

i would have thought there would have been some more sightings since it was in one spot so long?  i never considered reporting this but after researching felt it might be a good idea, even if there is a logical explanation - which i hope is the case.
content.summary: Bright round light hovered 45+ minutes in the same spot, definately not a plane.

content.detailedDescription:
a few days before christmas on my senior year in high school my couisin and i had just visited with a friend when we decided to take a ride on some of the dirt roads close to our neighborhood. at one point we reached a 3 way intersection where the dirt road we were traveling on intersected a paved road. across the paved road was a house sitting on about a 1-acre lot. my cousin was driving and i was in the passengers seat as we were turning around to go back down the dirt road i saw an object come over the tree line behind the house.  
  at first i thought it was an airplane as it was a single bright light but as i watched it split into two seperate lights. as we got the truck turned around i continued to watch the object as it again split this time into four seperate lights. this object had come from the north and was moving alongside us as we drove back down the dirt road. i pointed the object out to my cousin as we continued to travel south along the dirt road and as we both looked at the object again it now appeare to have six to eight lights. the lights were different colors some were red others were blue and the rest were white.
 at this point we became a little frightened so we sped down the dirt road until we reached my cousins house where we watched the object from outside the vehicle. as we stood in his yard the object was almost directly on top of us and it was now stationary. the first though i had that suggested it wasnt just an airplane or a helicopter was that it was now hovering and made no noise. we watched it for a few more minutes before it began to move again. the object never rotated or anything it simply moved back to the north in the exact same direction it came from. 
  i cannot say for sure what i saw but it was silent and could hover and change directions without turning around. i have visited the site several times to try to logically explain this but as of now i have no idea what it could have been.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Myself and my cousin witnessed an object come from the north hover silently and move back to the north on the same bearing.

content.detailedDescription: It was hovering around for a few minutes, occasionally stopping, which gave me enough time to snap a picture, just in time before it shot straight up untill it disappeared, "it looked like a head of a dog".
content.summary: It was hovering around my apt.

content.detailedDescription: I took my dog out back, and while i was waiting for him i looked up.  the lights in my house were dark, and it's a very clear night so i had a really good look at the night sky.  i noticed a grouping of lights that were very close together and emitting a bright glow.  there were 5 lights, in a kite formation-- basically a diamond shape with a tail.  i got my husband and we studied this until the fog moved in-- about a half hour.  they pulsated light, and moved around quite a bit, but always returning to the same formation after "swarming" i would call it.  the lights were very high, but obviously closer than stars, and were definitely not stars.  if you looked away from the formation you could see a bluish glow around the formation, unlike a star.
content.summary: 5 lights in kite shaped formation very high bright and glowing.

content.detailedDescription:
I was at the kitchen sink and something in the sky caught my eye. (our kitchen window faces west).  at first i thought it was an airplane, but soon realized it wasn't moving. it was a very, very bright.  unlike anything i have ever seen before.  i thought maybe it was venus, but as i was watching it (for a few minutes), it slowly faded out. after the light went out, i did notice what i believe is the planet venus, lower on the horizon.  whatever i saw was higher up and appeared closer to my window. 

i should also note that i called my husband over and he saw it before it faded out as well. 

would love to find out what it was!! there must be a logical explanation!
content.summary: Bright oval shaped light in sky.
